LEVY.dev_comment: The Levy function has many local minima and is often used for benchmarking optimization algorithms. Global minimum is at (1, 1, ..., 1) and has a value of 0.
LEVY.reference: @article{levy1975function, title={On a Class of Test Functions for Global Optimization}, author={Levy, David}, year={1975}, publisher={Springer}}
LEVY.summary: Multimodal, continuous, non-convex function with a global minimum at (1, 1, ..., 1). Suitable for testing the ability of optimization algorithms to avoid local minima and converge to the global minimum.
